column4: hey folks. when installing ubuntu, i chose to "configure networking at a later time". i have correctly edited /etc/network/interfaces, and recieved an ip address + dns from dhcp server. however i can't access the internet. is there something else i need to configure?
what's the output of route and ifconfig commands?
so what's wrong with ping? does it say anything ?  :)
no output whatsoever... it just hangs :(
i can ping localhost and my LAN interface... anything on the inet does not work tho
can you ping ubuntu from another box? cable ok? remember windows xp's doesn't reply pings
i cannot ping ubuntu box from another box on lan
if your cables and hub work, there could be a wrong kernel module problem. I've also got IRQ sharing or wrong IRQ problems with NE2000 ISA cards
send your lspci -v output to pastebin, of course if it's a pci card
not sure what pci is, but the output of that command had something about ethernet in it so i here it is: http://pastebin.com/512934
so i'm supposed to modprobe that? i thought it was supposed to autoload as it's in /etc/modules
it should be autoloaded. it should work, I'm out of guesses
ok thanks anyway man... i guess i'll just re-install and let the installer set it up for me... that worked before
